author: @CSIMarket
title: DJCO Shines with Stellar Conduct, Despite Earnings Setback in Q4 2023
text: | Sector | | Industry |â€¢ Services DJCO Shines with Stellar Conduct, Despite Earnings Setback in Q4 2023 Daily Journal Corporation*s Q4 2023: Revenue Surge Tempered by Unfavorable Earnings Per Share Published Dec 29 2023 / Modified Dec 29 2023 Goran Soko / CSIMarket.com Contributer While the company experienced a 12.169% increase in revenue from the previous year, reaching $21.55 million, it also reported a loss of $-4.71 per share. This is a significant decrease in earnings compared to the previous financial reporting period, where the company saw a revenue improvement of 21.724% from $17.70 million and earnings per share fell from $0.49. In the July to September 30, 2023 financial time-frame, Daily Journal Corporation reported a net shortfall of $-6.485 million. However, this is still an improvement compared to the deficit of $-44.827 million during the same period last year. It is worth mentioning that inventoriesand supplies have increased to $0.1 million, indicating a build-up in stock compared to the previous quarter and the corresponding quarter from the previous year. Daily Journal Corporation's operating earnings fell -6.36% to $3.43 million, resulting in a decrease in the operatingmargin from 19.07% in the fourth quarter of 2022 to 15.92% in the fourth quarter of 2023. Furthermore, there has been a noticeable increase in accounts receivable, which suggests a rise in demand for the company?s products or services. Accounts receivables were valued at $18.7 million, higher than the preceding quarter. On a more positive note, for the financial year 2023, the company announced profitability of $21.45 million and revenue of $67.71 million. This is an improvement from the previous financial year, where Daily Journal Corporation recorded a loss per share of $-54.81 and revenue increased by 25.37% from $54.01 million. Looking ahead, Daily Journal Corporation is expected to release its next financial results on February 12, 2024. This will provide further insight into the company's progress and financial performance. It is essential to analyze these figures comprehensively to understand the overall financial health of Daily Journal Corporation. While the increase in revenue is positive, the significant loss per share and operating margin decrease raise concerns. However, the improved accounts receivable and annual profitability indicate potential growthfor the company. Investors and stakeholders should closely monitor the upcoming financial results to make informed decisions about Daily Journal Corporation's future.
